etymologies: early 20th century: coined in German from Latin receptor, from recept- ‘taken back’, from the verb recipere (see receive)

definitions: an organ or cell able to respond to light, heat, or other external stimulus and transmit a signal to a sensory nerve

examples.text: the retina of the octopus has up to 20 million light receptors

shortDefinitions: organ or cell able to respond to light, heat, or other external stimulus

definitions: a region of tissue, or a molecule in a cell membrane, which responds specifically to a particular neurotransmitter, hormone, antigen, or other substance

examples.text: when viruses succeed in binding to cell membrane receptors they still have to enter the cell before they can replicate

shortDefinitions: region of tissue, or molecule in cell membrane
